quiz.text: Which one of the following organisations has not participated in the release of recently (August 2023) released the “The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2023” report?
options: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)
International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD)
United Nations Children’s Fund (UNICEF)
World Bank
World Food Programme (WFP)

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released report “The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2023”, global hunger, is impacting approximately __________ of the global population in 2022 compared to 7.9% in 2019.
options: 9.2%
9.3%
9.4%
9.5%
9.6%

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (August 2023) released report “The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2023”.1. People in the world faced hunger in 2022 :: About 900 million2. The projected population will be chronically undernourished in 2030 :: 600 million3. Severely food insecure population in 2022 :: 735 million  Which of the following statements is/are incorrectly matched?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 2 and 3
Both 1 and 3
All of the above

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released report “The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2023”, the global gender gap in food insecurity, which had expanded during the pandemic, reduced from 3.8% points in 2021 to ________ points in 2022
options: 2.6%
2.5%
2.4%
2.3%
2.2%

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (August 2023) released report “The State of Food Security and Nutrition in the World 2023”.1. 148.1 million children under five years of age (22.3%) :: were wasted2. 45 million (6.8%) :: were stunted3. 37 million (5.6%) :: were overweightWhich of the following statements is/are correctly matched?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 1 and 2
Only 3
Both 2 and 3

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations has recently (August 2023) released the State of Education in Rural India 2023 report?
options: Pratham
Ministry of Education
Development Intelligence Unit (DIU)
Central Board of Secondary Education
Ministry of Rural Development

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), “State of the Education in Rural India 2023”, was released, the report highlights progress in gender-neutral education among rural communities and focuses on the 6 to 16-year-old children and the data is accumulated from 6,229 rural households across 20 states in India. In the context of the findings of the report, a total of ________ % of parents of girls and __________% of parents of boys wanted to educate their children to graduation and above.
options: 78 & 82
82 & 72
62 & 72
72 & 62
52 & 42

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (August 2023) released “State of the Education in Rural India 2023” report.A. A total of 48.7% of parents of boys said that the main reason for their sons to drop out of school was the lack of interest.B. 71.8% of parents of the boys said the reason to drop out was to help in the family’s earnings.C. The biggest reason for the girls dropping out of school, according to their parents was to take care of household chores.Which of the following statements is/are incorrect?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and C
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (August 2023) released “State of the Education in Rural India 2023” report.A. 35% of male children dropped out of school during primary schooling.B. The dropout rate at primary schooling was higher for female children at nearly 25%C. Nearly 75% boys and 65% girls dropped out of school after completing primary school education.Which of the following statements is/are incorrect?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (August 2023) released “State of the Education in Rural India 2023” report.A. 60% of students have access to smartphones in rural India.B. 58.32% of students belonging to Class 8 or above have access to smartphones.C. 42.1% between classes 1 and 3 have access to smartphones.Which of the following statements is/are correct?
options: Only A
Only B
Both B and C
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the recently, (August 2023) released 6th Census on Minor Irrigation (MI) Schemes Report, the 23.14 million minor irrigation (MI) schemes have been reported in the country, out of which ______________ are Ground Water (GW) and ___________ are Surface Water (SW) schemes.

quiz.text: Recently (August 2023), “The State of India’s Birds 2023” report was released, the report used over 30 million observations uploaded to the ____________ platform by more than 30,000 birdwatchers to evaluate the distribution range size of 942 Indian birds.

eBird24*7
eIndianBirds
e-chidiya
ePanchi

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released, “The State of India’s Birds 2023” report, out of the total of 942 species evaluated, long-term trends could be determined for 338 species out of which, 204 species have declined, 98 are stable, _________ have increased.
options: 38
37
36
35
34

options: Only 1

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released Digital-in-Health: Unlocking the Value for Everyone mentioned in the above passage, health systems worldwide use less than _____________ of available health data to improve patient outcomes.

quiz.text: Recently, (August 2023) released Digital-in-Health: Unlocking the Value for Everyone report mentioned in the above passage, proposes ten recommendations across three priority areas for governments to invest in: prioritize, connect and scale.Which of the following is not one of them?
options: Leadership and partnership
Local governance
Digital infrastructure and health information gaps
Digital skills and literacy
Global and regional collaboration

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released Digital in Health – Unlocking Value for Everyone report, people-centred and evidence-based digital investments can help governments save up to _______ of health system costs and reach the underserved.
options: 14%
15%
16%
17%
18%

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released Digital in Health – Unlocking Value for Everyone report, in India, World Bank support enabled over _________ of Anganwadi workers to use digital technology.
options: 45%
50%
60%
40%
80%

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released “Air Quality Life Index 2023” by the Energy Policy Institute, ______________  has emerged as the world's most polluted city, with its 18 million residents on track to lose 11.9 years of life expectancy on average relative to the WHO limit and 8.5 years relative to the national guideline if the current pollution levels persist.
options: Beijing
Delhi
Faridabad
Kanpur
Gurugram

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released “Air Quality Life Index 2023” by the Energy Policy Institute, which of the following is not among the top 5 worst hit nations by air pollution?
options: Bangladesh
India
Bhutan
Mongolia
Nepal

quiz.text: According to the recently (August 2023) released “Air Quality Life Index 2023” by the Energy Policy Institute, __________ of India’s population lives in areas that exceed the country's own national air quality standard of 40 μg/m3.
options: 65.4%
63.4%
66.4%
67.4%
68.4%
